details: “K” is the eleventh letter of the modern English alphabet. It is often silent when placed before 'n' at the start of a word (like 'knife'), but commonly represents the /k/ sound as in 'kite'.

wordsData.definition: a light frame covered with cloth or paper, flown in the wind at the end of a long string
wordsData.example: The child flew a red kite at the park.

wordsData.definition: a small piece of metal used to open locks
wordsData.example: He used the key to unlock the door.

wordsData.definition: a large Australian marsupial that moves by hopping on its powerful hind legs
wordsData.example: The kangaroo carried its baby in a pouch.

wordsData.definition: the male ruler of an independent state, especially one who inherits the position by birth
wordsData.example: The king wore a golden crown.

rhymes.name: K is for Kite (to the tune of 'Twinkle, Twinkle')
content: K is for kite flying high,
Watch it dip and watch it dive,
K is for kite flying high,
Touching clouds way up in the sky!

rhymes.name: K is for Kangaroo (to the tune of 'Mary Had a Little Lamb')
content: Hop, hop, hop, hop, hop, hop.
